Disrupting all that divides us

Whitney has boxes of them stacked in his tiny office, ready to hand out like the proverbial proud father with his cigars after the arrival of a newborn.

Top Davidson County residential real estate sales for October 2025, as compiled by the Nashville Ledger.

So far, he’s a step backward from Levis

Titans’ midseason grades: Failure in almost all subjects
Since the Titans are on a bye week, it is time to give out our midseason report card grades for the team. Let’s just say that not many folks are on the honor roll. In fact, some may be headed for summer school just to keep from repeating this dismal performance.
Bud Adams, Robert Kraft among Pro Football Hall of Fame contributor semifinalists
Six-time Super Bowl-winning owner Robert Kraft and Bud Adams, who founded the Houston Oilers and was a key part of the formation of the AFL, are among the nine contributors who advanced to the semifinal stage for the Pro Football Hall of Fame's Class of 2026.
Few options for Preds with Stamkos contract
When Predators general manager Barry Trotz spent big July 1, 2024, not on some big name but on over-30 free agents Steven Stamkos, Jonathan Marchessault and Brady Skjei, the hope was that the three established NHL veterans still had enough tread on the tires to help the team be competitive for years to come. The 2024-25 season was disastrous for those three and the Predators as a whole.
NHL’s punch-drunk fight ‘code’ makes little sense
Fighting in the NHL is a divisive and much-debated topic. The years of multiple fights per game and roster spots occupied by players whose sole responsibility was dropping the gloves with opponents on a nightly basis are long gone. But fighting is still a thing in the NHL, albeit at a much lower rate than decades past.
Wounded Predators
Recent injuries have started to hit the Predators roster. Here’s a look at who is out and when they may return.
Neighborhood Health names chief clinical officer
Neighborhood Health, Inc. has selected Matthew S. Joseph, M.D., MBA, as its chief clinical officer.
3 Nashville restaurants earn Michelin stars
The Michelin Guide has unveiled its first-ever selection for the American South, naming three Nashville restaurants among the region’s inaugural Michelin Star honorees.
Comparing the new BMW X3, Mercedes-Benz GLC
Compact luxury crossovers are ideal if you’re seeking a compelling blend of utility and style without having to pay full-size luxury SUV pricing. The BMW X3 has been a front-runner since the original model’s introduction in 2003, but it continues to face stiff competition from the Mercedes-Benz GLC.
Having trouble with Gen Z workers? Find a way to adapt
After the interview, you gave a job applicant an “A” and hired her. Since then, she’s been late two days out of five, she leaves early most afternoons and her co-workers say she’s abrasive. You thought she’d be a great employee, but now you’re at the end of your rope.
Tennessee death row inmate Harold Wayne Nichols asks governor for life in prison instead

It's also in the news, with a growing list of sports betting scandals making headlines.
What to know about the status of SNAP food aid as a vote nears to end the shutdown

The Mega Millions jackpot has grown to $965 million for Friday's drawing after no ticket matched all six numbers, according to lottery officials.

More than 80 organizations that provide health care for women all over the world received grants Wednesday totaling $250 million from Melinda French Gates after a year-long application process.

Anthropic, Microsoft announce new AI data center projects as industry's construction push continues

Atlanta Fed president Bostic to retire in February, opening seat on key committee
WASHINGTON (AP) — Raphael Bostic, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta, will retire at the end of his current term in February, opening up a new seat on the Fed's interest-rate setting committee at a time that President Donald Trump is seeking to exert more control over the central bank.

NEW YORK (AP) — The end of the longest U.S. government shutdown in history would be a relief for small businesses that depend on federal contracts or funding. For seven weeks, they've been reducing spending, weighing layoffs and looking for stable work while trying to reach shuttered government offices, according to several contractors.
Unlucky penny: US Mint in Philadelphia to press final penny as the 1-cent coin gets canceled

The White House quickly accused Democrats of selectively leaking the emails to smear the president.

But there are still calls for him to step aside from Democrats who think he should have fought harder.

WASHINGTON (AP) — A Virginia Democrat who helped investigate the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol is making a comeback bid after last week's sweeping election wins as her party looks to break President Donald Trump's grip on federal power in the 2026 midterms.

NEW YORK (AP) — Mika Zibanejad scored to end a lengthy goal drought on home ice, Gabriel Perreault picked up his first NHL point and the New York Rangers used an offensive outburst to defeat the Nashville Predators 6-3 on Monday night for their first victory at Madison Square Garden this season.
Trump pardons the husband of Republican supporter Rep. Diana Harshbarger of Tennessee
